Description: Mould-made pottery plastic lamp in the form of Harpokrates as a nude seated boy, wearing an elaborate head-dress and a bell round his neck, and holding a shrine of Athena in his left arm and a torch in his right hand. Athena wears a long chiton and helmet, and holds a shield and spear. The boy sits on a lamp has a slightly domed top and a concave-sided round-topped nozzle. On top of the head is a pierced lug for suspension, decorated with impressed ovules. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q606)
